ANGLE_instanced_arrays.summary: The ANGLE_instanced_arrays extension is part of the WebGL API and allows to draw the same object, or groups of similar objects multiple times, if they share the same vertex data, primitive count and type.

remarks.para: WebGL extensions are available using the method. For more information, see also Using Extensions in the WebGL tutorial.

blockquote.para: This extension is only available to {{domxref("WebGLRenderingContext", "WebGL1", "", 1)}} contexts. In {{domxref("WebGL2RenderingContext", "WebGL2", "", 1)}}, the functionality of this extension is available on the WebGL2 context by default and the constants and methods are available without the ANGLE_ suffix.

Despite the name "ANGLE", this extension works on any device if the hardware supports it and not just on Windows when using the ANGLE library. "ANGLE" just indicates that this extension has been written by the ANGLE library authors.

ANGLE_instanced_arraysDrawArraysInstance.summary: The ANGLE_instanced_arrays.drawArraysInstancedANGLE() method of the WebGL API renders primitives from array data like the method. In addition, it can execute multiple instances of the range of elements.

blockquote.para: When using , this method is available as by default.

ANGLE_instanced_arraysDrawElementsInstan.summary: The ANGLE_instanced_arrays.drawElementsInstancedANGLE() method of the WebGL API renders primitives from array data like the method. In addition, it can execute multiple instances of a set of elements.

blockquote.para: When using , this method is available as by default.

ANGLE_instanced_arraysVertexAttribDiviso.summary: The ANGLE_instanced_arrays.vertexAttribDivisorANGLE() method of the WebGL API modifies the rate at which generic vertex attributes advance when rendering multiple instances of primitives with and .

blockquote.para: When using , this method is available as by default.
